strapiAbout.bio:
My design background comes from a combination of technical training and higher education; including printing, prepress, desktop publishing, problem solving and concept development. Coupled with over 5 years of experience in the print industry, I've gained the skills and expereience required to craft design ideas into real deliverable solutions.

In recent years Iâ€™ve been learning web development as a new creative medium to build websites and user interfaces. I'm currently looking for opportunities in the tech space as a UI designer or front-end developer. ðŸ¦„

**Fun Facts:**
- I collect business cards, {{CARDS}} and counting.
- I have no middle name.
- [Fira Code](https://github.com/tonsky/FiraCode) is my favorite typeface for writing code.
strapiAbout.heading: Design Thinker, Lifetime Learner, Tech Enthusiast

nodes.name: Chris Do
nodes.description: Founder of [Blind](https://blind.com/), a brand strategy design consultancy and [The Futur](https://thefutur.com/), a new online education platform that's changing the way we think about creative businesses and design education. It almost feels like a contemporary version of the Bauhaus, but with a new mission. If you are a creative business owner or professional I highly recommend his content. [@theChrisDo](https://twitter.com/theChrisDo)

nodes.name: Jacqueline Casey
nodes.description: Master of visual puns and Helvetica. A local Massachusetts design legend best known for her poster design work at [MIT](http://www.mit.edu/).

nodes.name: Walter Gropius
nodes.description: An architect and founder of the [Staatliches Bauhaus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bauhaus). In 2018, I visited Walter's historic home in Lincoln, MA to learn more; [Gropius House](https://www.historicnewengland.org/property/gropius-house/) is an exceptional example of Gropius' design thinking and teachings of the Bauhaus. Although it was shortlived, the Bauhaus has heavily influenced the arts and design education. It's also become the most influential part of my personal design style and process.

nodes.name: Mattias Petter Johansson
nodes.description: Otherwise known as MPJ, the host of [FunFunFunction](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCO1cgjhGzsSYb1rsB4bFe4Q) and co-host of [DevTips](https://www.youtube.com/user/DevTipsForDesigners). FunFunFunction was the main catalyst that brought me into the world of web developement and programming, especially JavaScript. [@mpjme](https://twitter.com/mpjme)

nodes.name: Jen Simmons
nodes.description: Jen is a designer advocate at [Mozilla](https://www.mozilla.org/) and member of the CSS Working Group. She occupies a very unique space as someone who understands the history of both the web and graphic design. Her YouTube content via [Layout Land](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7TizprGknbDalbHplROtag) (and more recently [Mozilla Developer](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCh5UlGiu9d6LegIeUCW4N1w)) helped me bridge the gap between designing for print vs the web using CSS. [@jensimmons](https://twitter.com/jensimmons)

nodes.name: Anne Carter
nodes.description: A pivotal professor in my design education, her passion for art/design is only outshined by her design expertise and candid vibe. She helped me find, harness and refine my creativity to match my technical skill set.
